description: Dive into "Romantic Escapes in Enchanting Turin" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Romantic Escapes in Enchanting Turin

places.generalDescription: Piazza San Carlo is a bustling city plaza in Turin known for its 17th-century baroque architecture and as a venue for concerts and events. The square is surrounded by elegant porticoed buildings housing bars, cafes, and restaurants where visitors can immerse themselves in the local lifestyle. It's also home to an equestrian statue of Emanuele Filiberto sculpted by Carlo Marocchetti in 1838.

sources.snippet: As one of the main city squares in Turin, it‚Äôs busy day and night and you must visit at different times to see its beauty. Laid out in the 16th and 17th centuries, the Baroque-style square has earned a reputation for being a stage for historical and social events, and from here you can reach many famous places in Turin like:. ‚Äì one of the most important baroque palaces in Turin, it has two different facades, and you can walk through its courtyard.
sources.shortName: 27 Things To Do in Turin, Italy - Travel Tips From a Local

sources.snippet: Piazza Carignano: one of the city's most romantic squares, a corner of caf√©s and history in the shadow of Palazzo Carignano, which houses the Apartments of the Princes and the National Museum of the Italian Risorgimento, as well as the seat of the First Italian Parliament.
sources.shortName: Torino: a city to fall in love with

places.name: Piazza San Carlo

reviews.text: A beautiful square in Turin lined by stunning buildings, churches, shops, and restaurants. It is a massive square, so plenty of room to walk around and see the pure majestic beauty. We loved our visit. We visited a few of the churches, loved the monument in the middle, and enjoyed looking in the shop windows. A must see when in Turin.
One of the most beautiful piazza in Torino , many restaurants are located there , so close to shops in Via Roma and close few minutes walking distance Porta nouva station!

The church at Piazza San Carlo is beautiful and peaceful. It's not very big, but the architecture and details inside are really impressive. It's a nice place to stop by if you're walking around the city.
It feels calm and quiet inside, a nice break from the busy streets of Milan.
Definitely worth a quick visit if you enjoy historic buildings and quiet spots.

places.address: P.za S. Carlo, 10123 Torino TO, Italy

places.generalDescription: Parco del Valentino is a historic park and castle with medieval origins located on the riverbank. It features historic trees, a rock garden, and the 18th century Botanical Garden. The park overlooks the Po River and sits at the foot of a hill, offering beautiful scenery. Additionally, it houses the Castle, one of the Royal Residences, and a Medieval Village. This landmark park is known for its rich history and picturesque surroundings.

sources.snippet: The passeggiata (afternoon stroll) is as sacred in Turin as any other Italian city. At weekends families flock to the seemingly endless, grassy grounds of 19th-century Parco Valentino to stroll along the Po river banks, peruse botanical gardens, snap selfies in front of mock chateau Castello del Valentino and kick balls around. Joggers enliven serpentine footpaths by day, romancing couples come dusk.
sources.shortName: The 15 best free things to do in Turin

sources.snippet: Located on the west bank of the River Po that runs through the city, Parco del Valentino makes for lovely walks. Along the river you can admire the architecture of the grand villas and residences that line the river banks. The park is also home to the Castello del Valentino ‚Äì one of the Residences of the Royal House of Savoy with UNESCO World Heritage Site status.
sources.shortName: 12 Must-Visit Attractions In Turin, Italy

sources.snippet: It‚Äôs all about the long walks in this glorious stretch of park straddling the banks of the mighty river, Po. Massive villas, grand residences, and the Castello del Valentino (another royal Savoy palace) are just some of the highlights here to explore, along with the Botanical Gardens, the Torino Esposizioni and Underground Pavilion Complex and the Borgo Medievale, an open-air museum mimicking the late-medieval architecture of the Piedmont region. As with any grand park in Italy, there‚Äôs also a rather opulent fountain in the form of the very striking Fontana dei 12 mesi (Fountain of the Months) which comes to life day and night with a dazzling waterworks show that spins off each of its allegorical marble statues.
sources.shortName: The best things to do in Turin: an insider's guide

sources.snippet: Close to the DUPARC Contemporary Suites stands one of Turin‚Äôs green lungs, the Parco del Valentino, featuring a small oasis of neat, scented flower beds and age-old trees known as the Rock Garden. And in the Rock Garden stands a much loved work of art, the lamp posts in love, which attract tourists from far and wide and makes the locals smile, day after day and season after season.
sources.shortName: What to do in Turin on Valentine‚Äôs Day

sources.snippet: You can‚Äôt say you traveled to Turin if you didn‚Äôt visit Parco Del Valentino. It‚Äôs an oasis of 5000,00m¬≤ in the heart of the city alongside the River Po, and spending an afternoon here is one of the top things to do in Turin. It‚Äôs where we go for a run or to cycle, where we meet friends, do picnics, through parties and it‚Äôs our beach during Summer.
sources.shortName: 27 Things To Do in Turin, Italy - Travel Tips From a Local

sources.snippet: While walking in Parco del Valentino, you will come across the Giardino Roccioso, among exotic plants and fountains. In this part of the park, there is a sculpture that portrays two streetlights sitting on a bench, affectionately leaning on each other. It seems a good spot for a romantic walk and a kiss next to the ‚Äúbench of lovers‚Äù.
sources.shortName: Valentine‚Äôs day in Turin

sources.snippet: All great cities need a central green space and Parco del Valentino is Torino‚Äôs. Nestled on the west bank of the Po River, this charming park stands as one of Turin‚Äôs oldest, not to mention one of the best parks in all of Italy. The setting is ideal, alongside the Po River and flush with towering trees, flowers, and birds.
sources.shortName: 30 Best Things to do in Turin, Italy - Top Tips from a Local

sources.snippet: Located on the banks of the river Po, the Parco Valentina is the second largest public park in Turin and covers an area of 500,000 m2. Created in 1856, it serves as the cities first public garden and has gone from strength to strength.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Turin (Italy)

sources.snippet: There are parks and piazzas and paths all along the beautiful Po river through Turin. I always thought the Po was a big industrialized polluted river, but it is gorgeous. People were crewing, dogs were swimming, the cafes were full.
sources.shortName: TWO NIGHTS IN TURIN

places.name: Parco del Valentino

reviews.text:
It's like a gem in Torin,
Po river passes along this park make. This place super spectacular , if you do out door sport here is the best choice for you, so many people at running, cycling and foind diffrent kind of sport.
you can find squirrels there and feed  them, they are so funny and cute.

Very nice garden to have a walk or even a picnic
It's perfect if you have kids for It's large playing area which is free of charge, also there is other paid games for small charges
Is great to get lost there. To walk, run or just enjoy sitting around. Needs a little maintenance in some areas tho. But full of silvester friendly animals which make it amazing.

places.address: Corso Massimo d'Azeglio, 10126 Torino TO, Italy

places.generalDescription: Discover the charm of Turin with the Free Walking Tour Turin, where friendly and knowledgeable guides like Angelo and Laura will take you on an informative and enjoyable journey through the city's history. From visits to historical landmarks like the House of Savoy palace to indulging in traditional drinks at local cafes, this tour offers a great introduction to Turin.

sources.snippet: As with most historic cities, there‚Äôs a lot more than what meets the eye. Torino is no exception. About 50 feet below street level is a maze-like world of 18th-century tunnels, World War 2 bunkers, and ice cellars that date back to Roman times and were used by royal kitchens to store food.
sources.shortName: 30 Best Things to do in Turin, Italy - Top Tips from a Local

places.name: Free Walking Tour Turin

reviews.text: Hands down recommend this tour! Had an amazing time exploring Torino with Laura - she's knowledgeable, enthusiastic, and made the whole experience unforgettable üòä‚ù§Ô∏è. The city came alive through her stories and insights!

We had a wonderful tour with Laura! Very knowledgeable about the city and a very friendly and welcoming disposition. Such a great way to get acquainted with the city at the start of a trip. We'll be telling all our friends to visit Turin and do the tour!

‚ÄúLaura as a guide in Turin is highly recommended. Through her, we gained a deeper understanding of the local mentality of subtlety and learned about the origins of Lavazza, Martini, and Giandotti chocolate. She made the experience unforgettable!‚Äù
Guru walk!!

places.address: Piazza Carlo Felice, 10121 Torino TO, Italy

places.generalDescription: The Royal Palace of Turin is a must-see museum that was once the residence of the Italian royal family. It features ornate apartments, sculptures, and furniture, as well as an armory, garden, and chapel. The palace showcases the history of the duchy of Piedmont to the Kingdom of Italy, including French invasions and Napoleon's influence. Visitors can explore its beautiful artwork and learn about its rich history.

sources.snippet: I‚Äôm sure you will be awed by the history and beauty of the royal complex with two UNESCO heritage sites in only one place. The Palazzo Reale Torino ‚Äì Royal Palace of Turin ‚Äì was built by the House of Savoy in the 16th century and has many important attractions within its walls. You will spend two to three hours wandering around the Royal Apartments, admiring the throne hall, exploring the Royal Library and the Royal Armory, and relaxing in the gardens.
sources.shortName: 27 Things To Do in Turin, Italy - Travel Tips From a Local

sources.snippet: Relive ancient royal love by visiting the Royal Palace in the city centre, Villa della Regina, the magnificent Reggia di Venaria or the Palazzina di Caccia di Stupinigi, just outside Turin. The sumptuous interiors, enchanting gardens and royal history create a romantic and cultural experience. Walk through the frescoed halls and manicured gardens to experience a very special Valentine's Day.
sources.shortName: Valentine's Day in Torino and its province: discover the most romantic places and events

sources.snippet: For a truly memorable experience, consider a private evening visit to the Royal Library within the Royal Palace complex. The library houses precious artifacts and art collections, including sketches by Leonardo da Vinci. Special tours are sometimes available in the evenings, allowing couples to explore its treasures in a quiet, intimate setting.
sources.shortName: Things to do at night in Turin to experience the city like a local
City Break in Turin: what to see in 2 days

places.name: Royal Palace of Turin

reviews.text: Absolute must if you are visiting Torino. Despite me visiting in the touristic season, the crowdedness was actually very low and we could move around freely through the palace. Staff was very helpful and polite, they guided me to the ticket center and showed me the route of visit. Palace looks absolutely stunning and when you look at all the decorations and the gigantism of the structure you can just imagine the power and wealth the royal family had back then. The object is easy to reach as it is located in the center of Torino and has good public transport connections around it. Very recommend this place, you can learn many interesting facts about the history of the palace and the royal family of Savoy.

A large, well-priced museum with many awesome pieces. However, if you are there for the Armory, know that you will have less than 10 minutes in the room. They do small guided tours and only allow 10 minutes per group. Unfortunately, for me, this is worth docking the star. I visited here SPECIFICALLY for the armory as I am a medieval collector. I don't mind that there is a small group guided tour, but it was so quick. My wife and I were taking pictures and only got about halfway through the room when the guide forced us out and they said we could not visit a second time :(

The palace itself is truly spectacular and the art is vast and beautiful. Definitely one of the best museums minus the armory issue.

CLOSED WEDNESDAY so plan accordingly.

Absolutely worth a visit for history and art lovers. Majestic, easy to access, and surprisingly quiet, it offers a rich cultural experience without the crowds of major tourist attractions. A hidden gem you can truly enjoy at your own pace. üôè

places.address: Piazzetta Reale, 1, 10122 Torino TO, Italy

places.generalDescription: Chiesa di Santa Maria del Monte dei Cappuccini is a 16th-century church located on the picturesque Monte dei Cappuccini, a hill standing at 325 meters high near the Po River in Turin. The hill offers stunning panoramic views of the city, river, and breathtaking sunsets. It's conveniently close to the historic center and can be reached by crossing the Vittorio Emanuele Bridge.

sources.snippet: Post-church, head uphill to Monte dei Cappuccini, crowned by the bijou Chiesa di Santa Maria del Monte dei Cappuccini and panoramic views across the Po River and Turin rooftops. The show at sunset is spectacular.
sources.shortName: The 15 best free things to do in Turin

sources.snippet: Being at the foot of the alps, you will get to witness some beautiful views of the mountains as you walk around the city, especially when taking in the view from Santa Maria di Monte dei Cappuccini. Turin is a great mix of alpine, Italian and French beauty. It feels almost similar to the city we‚Äôve lived in ‚Äì Grenoble ‚Äì but more historical, romantic, and dramatic in terms of views and overall vibes.
sources.siteName: Offbeat Escapades | Offbeat Travels & Van Life Blog
sources.shortName: Is Turin Worth Visiting? 7 Reasons Why You Need to Visit Italy's Hidden Gem - Offbeat Escapades

sources.snippet: Monte dei Cappuccini is one of the most popular spots for local couples, so much so that it is known as the lovers' square. Alternatively, you can choose to take the historic Sassi-Superga tramway up to the Basilica di Superga. Another popular spot in the city is Parco Europa, where the breathtaking scenery and tranquil atmosphere create a romantic ambience.
sources.shortName: Valentine's Day in Torino and its province: discover the most romantic places and events

sources.snippet: A good alternative to Superga is Monte dei Cappuccini, on the right riverbank of Po. It is very close to the historical center, hence it‚Äôs easily accessible. From this hill, you can enjoy the city and its wonders, thanks to the square outside of the monastery of the Cappuccini monks, from which it takes the name.
sources.shortName: Valentine‚Äôs day in Turin

sources.snippet: We recommend Monte dei Cappuccini, Parco Europa, Parco di Villa Genero, Belvedere di Villa della Regina, and Superga. And indeed, Jean-Jacques Rousseau would agree with us, having described the view from Superga Hill as the most beautiful sight that the human eye could ever see.
sources.shortName: What to do in Turin on Valentine‚Äôs Day

sources.snippet: Then put on your comfy shoes and head to Monte dei Cappuccini. This hill is just 325 meters above the city and rises beside the River Po, another must-visit place in Turin. Why it‚Äôs so special?
sources.shortName: 27 Things To Do in Turin, Italy - Travel Tips From a Local

places.name: Chiesa di Santa Maria del Monte dei Cappuccini

reviews.text: The church itself is worth a visit but the main point to visit it is the view that you can get on Turin. It takes quite a lot of effort to reach it on foot (you can always take the bus to get there, but unfortunately it is not always avalaible at every time) but it is definitely worth it! The view that you get is truly spectacular, it will leave you breathless, and it is completely free of course!

Its good place to visit during good weather.. just its always full of people.. a lot of cars up there. In my opinion they should not allow the cars until the last stop... (until its for disabled persons).. beautiful view of Turin. U can bring up snacks  and enjoy there

Visiting this Church is your best intro with Turin. It's located just across the city center, on the other side of Po river.
Chiesa Santa Maria del Monte dei Cappuccini is a Baroque Church dating back to 16c with more appealing interiors than exterior.
However, the moment you reach the elevated terrace in front of the Church you're overwhelmed with absolute best views of entire Turin with the Alps in the background.
Have in mind most reviews here are for the views, not the Church. The Church I'd rate 3 (average), but the views are outstanding.

places.address: Piazzale Monte dei Cappuccini, 3, 10131 Torino TO, Italy

places.generalDescription: Perched atop Superga hill, the Basilica of Superga is a magnificent baroque church with a commanding dome that offers breathtaking views of the Alpine surroundings. Designed by renowned architect Filippo Juvarra in the early 18th century, this grand basilica replaced an existing church and holds great historical significance as it serves as the burial site for the royal House of Savoy.

sources.snippet: In the 18th century, under the rule of Vittorio Amadeo II, Turin was facing likely defeat by the French army. The story goes that while visiting a small chapel on the tallest hill overlooking the city, Amadeo vowed to build a church if Turin was victorious. And so the church was built on the Superga hill with stunning views over the city and wider landscape.
sources.shortName: 12 Must-Visit Attractions In Turin, Italy

sources.snippet: Built in 1706 under the direct order of Vittorio Amedeo II the shrine was built to honour the Virgin Mary when Turin was saved from besieging French and Spanish armies. Built on top of a surrounding hill, it‚Äôs the final resting place of the Savoy family (Italy‚Äôs former royals) whose overtly lavish tombs make for excellent sightseeing. The view from up here is also simply astounding, as is the dome.
sources.shortName: The best things to do in Turin: an insider's guide

sources.snippet: The Basilica of Superga is one of the top places to visit in Turin because of its architecture and location, on the top of a hill overlooking the city. The Basilica of Superga opened to service in 1731and it‚Äôs a great example of Baroque-Classicism architecture. It is a good place to go with family and kids as you can combine history, nature and a lovely ride on a vintage tram.
sources.shortName: 27 Things To Do in Turin, Italy - Travel Tips From a Local

sources.snippet: Sitting high on the hills overlooking Turin, Basilica di Superga is another fantastic thing to see in Turin. The historic baroque Basilica, built in the early 1700s, was designed by Filippo Juvarra who also worked on several Savoy residences including the facade of Palazzo Madama. The Basilica is a huge part of Torinese history.
sources.shortName: 30 Best Things to do in Turin, Italy - Top Tips from a Local

sources.snippet: Alternatively, you can choose to take the historic Sassi-Superga tramway up to the Basilica di Superga. Another popular spot in the city is Parco Europa, where the breathtaking scenery and tranquil atmosphere create a romantic ambience.
sources.shortName: Valentine's Day in Torino and its province: discover the most romantic places and events

sources.snippet: If you climb to the heights of the Superga mountain range to the east of Turin you will find the beautiful Basilica di Superga.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Turin (Italy)

places.name: Basilica of Superga

reviews.text:
The Superga Basilica sits atop the hill on the northern side of the city. It's visible from miles around when driving towards Turin.
You can reach it by car - they have a big parking lot just right from the Church, or by a small train departing from the foot of the hill.
It's a big Baroque edifice, recently renovated and painted in royal dark yellow.
Visiting the main Church is free and the interiors are magnificent.
Visiting the crypt with Royal Savoy tombs and the viewing platform on the dome is paying.
From the terrace in front of the Church is a spectacular panoramic view of Turin.
At the back side is a commemoration site for the football victims plane crash in 1949

Ideally use the Funicular railway. It's a 18 minute trundle and maybe 5km up. Good views of the mountains of the Alps. In full Summer (we were early Spring) the many trees will screen a lot of the view. The best bit of the Superrga is the Basilica and the wonderful Royal House of Savoy tombs.

Nice Basilica to visit. Spectacular view from top of the mountain. I'm not a football fan so I haven't heard about Turin's team tragic aircraft crash near by. So it was something new to find out and learn. Speaking about Basilica's open time it is ridiculous.. Honestly.. It closes from 13:30 to 14:30.. Why? I understand if museum office might be closed but not church itself. We went in 13:18 and we were told by staff member that it is already closed.. 12 mins before schedule. Also pretty complicated  to get there. Bus or funicular goes only once an hour..

places.address: Strada Comunale alla Basilica di Superga, 73, 10132 Torino TO, Italy

places.generalDescription: Chiesa Parrocchiale della Gran Madre di Dio, a neoclassical Catholic church in Turin, was commissioned in 1814 to commemorate Vittorio Emanuele of Savoy's return after Napoleon's defeat. Situated near the Po river and facing the Vittorio Emanuele Bridge and Piazza Vittorio Veneto, it offers stunning views of Monte dei Cappuccini.

sources.snippet: Pro tip: Finish your evening with a walk to the Gran Madre di Dio, a church with a staircase leading up to one of the best views of the city. It‚Äôs a romantic spot where you can look out over Turin‚Äôs cityscape and the Po River, an ideal place to end the night together.
sources.shortName: Things to do at night in Turin to experience the city like a local

places.name: Chiesa Parrocchiale della Gran Madre di Dio

reviews.text:
Stunning church. Small but lovely. You get an amazing view of the Piazza which is great to make some pictures. The church has an unique and wonderful atmosphere which increases visitors spiritual connection.
You can see the place where Pope John Paul II kneeled down to pray.
No tickets needed. Didn't see an accesible entrance.

You can find more interesting churches in the city, without the shadow of a doubt, it is not all that beautiful indeed, but it is still worth to visit it especially for the view that you get on Piazza Vittorio Veneto. Quite a few steps to do, but definitely worth the effort

Capping one end of the Via Po this Neoclassical church offers great views from the top of the steps along this arterial avenue to the Palazzo Madama. Looks amazing at night, but a little less grand inside than out.

places.address: Piazza Gran Madre di Dio, 4, 10131 Torino TO, Italy

places.generalDescription: Scannabue is a bustling restaurant located in the lively Turin neighborhood of San Salvario. The eatery offers a delectable selection of hearty North Italian dishes, including slow-braised beef simmered in Barolo wine gravy and served atop potato puree. The menu also features homemade bread, pasta, vitello tonnato, truffle pasta, and finanziera stew in winter.

sources.snippet: If it is true that this is one of the best Turin addresses, especially when it comes to wine, thanks to an extensive, non-trivial selection that is always changing and with the possibility to buy one or more bottles, it is equally true that the gastronomic proposal is a continuous source of surprises. Tradition goes hand in hand with focused creativity inspired by the season, and the kitchen team never misses a beat.
sources.shortName: Where to eat in Turin for Valentine's Day: the 8 restaurants chosen by Gambero Rosso

sources.snippet: Scannabue is a charming restaurant in Turin, Italy, known for its cozy atmosphere and delicious Piedmontese cuisine. With a focus on local ingredients and traditional recipes, it's a favorite spot for both locals and tourists looking to experience authentic Italian dining in a warm, inviting setting.
sources.shortName: Romantic Summer Getaway in Turin for Couples

places.name: Scannabue

reviews.text: On of the best meals we had during out trip! We stumbled upon this place through recommendations, and now that we've tried it we would recommend it too! First of all, their dishes were perfectly cooked and seasoned. Secondly, they offered comforting yet remarkable flavour combinations, my favourite was definitely the squid ink pasta. The tomato, the squid, and the bottarga melded together to create a perfect sauce that clings to the pasta, absolute perfection. They also served very good olive oil, be sure to enjoy it with their bread. Would love to pay another visit when the time comes, highly recommend!

Absolutely amazing place, we had a great night. I truly recommend their tasting menu and the price is incomparable to other places, they have been recognized by Michelin many times (for a reason) and the price is often cheaper than in majority of other places. Excellent quality, this was the best food we had in Turin. The service is also outstanding.

Scannabue is simply delicious. A true local experience, with carefully selected ingredients all sourced from the Piemonte region. The wines are excellent, the food is top quality, and every dish feels like a celebration of Piemonte's culture and tradition. If you want to taste authentic local cuisine in Torino, this is the place

places.address: Largo Saluzzo, 25/h, 10125 Torino TO, Italy

places.generalDescription: Palazzina di Caccia di Stupinigi is an exquisite 18th-century hunting lodge and royal residence located near Turin. Its grand gardens and luxurious apartments are a testament to European Baroque architecture. The lodge features a unique plan in the shape of a Sant'Andrea cross, with a central elliptical salon adorned with depictions of deer, symbolizing the Savoy's hunting traditions.

sources.snippet: Relive ancient royal love by visiting the Royal Palace in the city centre, Villa della Regina, the magnificent Reggia di Venaria or the Palazzina di Caccia di Stupinigi, just outside Turin. The sumptuous interiors, enchanting gardens and royal history create a romantic and cultural experience. Walk through the frescoed halls and manicured gardens to experience a very special Valentine's Day.
sources.shortName: Valentine's Day in Torino and its province: discover the most romantic places and events

places.name: Palazzina di Caccia di Stupinigi

reviews.text: We actually came out here to see the Christmas Market, but it is only open on weekends. I did not read that in Italian. We still really enjoyed the visit and seeing this beautiful palace. It is massive with beautiful gardens. Across the street are the former stables and farm houses. It is just a massive structure. We enjoyed our visit. It is a bit outside of town. From the main train station you must take Bus 282 or taxi (a taxi cost about 25 euros). We took the bus to the palace and a taxi back into town.

Stupinigi Castle is absolutely breathtaking, both from the outside and the inside. The architecture and decorative details are stunning, and every room tells a story. The staff were incredibly helpful and welcoming, which made the visit even more enjoyable. It's a must-see if you're in the area-an elegant blend of history, art, and beauty.

The inside of the palace was great, the same woman who was a tour guide at Moncaleri was a tour guide here and was a life saver helping is get tickets printed since we just had a receipt.
The palace was great, but the grounds were totally under construction and inaccessible... there should be a fee reduction in that case or at least some notice before you pay.

places.address: Piazza Principe Amedeo, 7, 10042 Stupinigi TO, Italy

places.generalDescription: Villa della Regina is a 17th-century royal palace located on the hills surrounding Turin. It was originally built as a vineyard and gardens complex for Prince-Cardinal Maurice of Savoy, but later expanded and adorned by Luisa Ludovica of Savoy, who made it her personal residence. The villa has been home to several Savoy queens over the centuries. Its Baroque beauty is complemented by frescoes, paintings, and Chinese cabinets.

sources.snippet: Relive ancient royal love by visiting the Royal Palace in the city centre, Villa della Regina, the magnificent Reggia di Venaria or the Palazzina di Caccia di Stupinigi, just outside Turin. The sumptuous interiors, enchanting gardens and royal history create a romantic and cultural experience. Walk through the frescoed halls and manicured gardens to experience a very special Valentine's Day.
sources.shortName: Valentine's Day in Torino and its province: discover the most romantic places and events

sources.snippet: This UNESCO-recognized Savoy Residence is a hidden gem sitting on the hills above Turin‚Äôs city center. The 17th-century residence was beloved by Savoy queens and other nobles because of the escape it offered away from the city among the gardens and grapevines of the estate. After suffering from damage and neglect, the Villa has been restored to reflect its former elegance.
sources.shortName: 30 Best Things to do in Turin, Italy - Top Tips from a Local

sources.snippet: We recommend Monte dei Cappuccini, Parco Europa, Parco di Villa Genero, Belvedere di Villa della Regina, and Superga. And indeed, Jean-Jacques Rousseau would agree with us, having described the view from Superga Hill as the most beautiful sight that the human eye could ever see.
sources.shortName: What to do in Turin on Valentine‚Äôs Day

places.name: Villa della Regina

reviews.text: Highly recommend to visit. Interiors are magnificent, gardens also. View for whole Torino is totally worth. It's a good place for rest and chill when the weather is good. You can sit on the bench and the garden and just enjoy the beauty of this place.

By far the best of the Savoy residences we visited today.  Moncaleri was under construction, awkward (with the police presence everywhere), and split our group in two (with an hour difference between).

The grounds are beautiful and peaceful, excellent stonework and a beautiful house.  Staff were helpful and kind.

This is such a wonderful place! The gardens are peaceful and truly beautiful, but the best part has to be the incredible views of the city (assuming it's a clear day without fog). I went during winter, but I can't wait to come back in spring or summer. I just know it'll be even better when everything's in bloom!

places.address: Strada Comunale Santa Margherita, 79, 10131 Torino TO, Italy

places.generalDescription: The Park Europa is a beautiful and peaceful park with panoramic views of the city. It's maintained in a semi-natural state, and is great for a picnic or just some calm from the city.

sources.snippet: We recommend Monte dei Cappuccini, Parco Europa, Parco di Villa Genero, Belvedere di Villa della Regina, and Superga. And indeed, Jean-Jacques Rousseau would agree with us, having described the view from Superga Hill as the most beautiful sight that the human eye could ever see.
sources.shortName: What to do in Turin on Valentine‚Äôs Day

sources.snippet: Another popular spot in the city is Parco Europa, where the breathtaking scenery and tranquil atmosphere create a romantic ambience.
sources.shortName: Valentine's Day in Torino and its province: discover the most romantic places and events

places.name: Parco Europa

reviews.text: Amazing view to the city

Parco Europa is a beautiful park but it definitely needs some more attention. You get a wonderful few of Turin plus a light hike, no difficult trails. It's a semi steep drive up but there is a parking lot where you can park your car. It's definitely worth going to see the sunset or sunrise, and the best times are when the flowers are blooming.
If you're without a car be prepared for an uphill climb but the city views from the top of the hill are well worth it. You can short cut by taking a bunch of stairs that aren't for the fainthearted

places.address: Via Nuova, 10133 Torino TO, Italy

places.generalDescription: Piano35 Ristorante is a trendy and popular cocktail bar located on a stunning rooftop in Turin. It offers an elegant interior with dark green velvet walls and classic decor. Situated on the thirty-fifth floor of the Intesa San Paolo skyscraper, it provides an unparalleled view of the city from 167.25 meters in height.

sources.snippet: On the thirty-fifth floor of the Intesa San Paolo skyscraper, at 167.25 meters in height and with a splendid 15,000 cubic meter bioclimatic greenhouse designed by Renzo Piano, you can enjoy an unparalleled view. Marco Sacco, an experienced chef, takes you gastronomically into the sky, assisted in the kitchen by Christian Balzo. In the evening, there are two levels of menus, with 4 and 6 courses, available in Piedmont, Giro d'Italia, and Piccolo Lago a Torino versions, referring to chef Sacco's historic restaurant.
sources.shortName: Where to eat in Turin for Valentine's Day: the 8 restaurants chosen by Gambero Rosso

places.name: Piano35 Ristorante

reviews.text: An amazing experience, we can for lunch and the view was incredible! The food was delicious, we were 4, took too small dishes and each took a main, the portions were just right, we also took 4 desserts and a wine bottle, and the bill was 288, with bread and water. In vegan and they can make the spaghetti with tomatoes vegan, and risotto with mushrooms vegan, we also took a pumpkin and removed the cheese. Vegan friendly and highly recommended

Unfortunately my partner got food poisoning- not what you would expect from a michelin star restaurant, let alone for a 370 euro bill. The food was okay, I found some of them to have too much powder (parsley, pepper etc etc) which ruins the overall dish. I wouldn't recommend as a fine dining

Went here for a late dinner in early August and was pleasantly surprised. The space is mesmerizing. Truly a beautiful space with an amazing view. If for nothing else, that alone should get you to stop by. The service was top notch. It is, after all, a Michelin starred space and, as such, it lives up to the expectations. Of particular highlight was the staff that paid individual attention to us. They got to know us, and had a very friendly banter throughout the night. Truly welcoming. Last - the food. I enjoyed it. Quite a bit. It's definitely on par with the competition. The highlight to me was the flavors and the quality. Overall, you can't go wrong. I would highly recommend this place.

places.address: Grattacielo Intesa Sanpaolo, C.so Inghilterra, 3, 10138 Torino TO, Italy

places.generalDescription: Located inside the Mole Antonelliana, a striking building with a neoclassical dome and spire, Turin's Museo Nazionale del Cinema offers a captivating collection of film-related artifacts and memorabilia. Originally designed as a synagogue in 1889, the museum now showcases devices, props, posters, and other items that document the history of cinema. Visitors can also take an elevator to the top of the dome for breathtaking views of the city and its mountainous backdrop.

sources.snippet: Over the years, Mole Antonelliana has become the undisputed symbol of Turin and even features on the Italian two-cent coin. When construction began in 1862 it was intended to pop up as a synagogue but, despite its religious intentions, was never once used as a place of worship. Now the 167m tower is home to the Museo Nazionale del Cinema, one fine museum exploring Turin‚Äôs longstanding relationship with the movies over the years.
sources.shortName: The best things to do in Turin: an insider's guide

sources.snippet: From the Turin Egyptian Museum, where you can enjoy an incredible selection of ancient art while visiting Turin, to the Museo Nazionale del Cinema, Italy's National Cinema Museum that tells the story of the country's impressive contributions to the art of film, there's plenty to do here.
sources.shortName: Things to do at night in Turin to experience the city like a local

sources.snippet: There is the magic of cinema hosted at the Museo del Cinema within the Mole Antonelliana, the Museo dell‚ÄôAutomobile that could not exist anywhere else but here, the Galleria d‚ÄôArte Moderna e Contemporanea that is always in the limelight for the quality and importance of its exhibitions.
sources.shortName: Best Places to Visit in Turin, Italy & Surroundings

sources.snippet: In Torino you can, with the panoramic lift that will take you from the heart of the Museo Nazionale del Cinema to the ‚Äòtempietto‚Äô, the little balcony at the tip of the Mole Antonelliana. The perfect setting for an unforgettable Valentine's Day
sources.shortName: Valentine's Day in Torino and its province: discover the most romantic places and events

places.name: Museo Nazionale del Cinema

reviews.text:
The Museo Nazionale del Cinema in Turin is an extraordinary celebration of the cinematic arts, housed within the breathtaking Mole Antonelliana. The moment you step inside, you're immersed in a vibrant and engaging exploration of film history, enhanced by stunning displays and interactive installations that captivate visitors of all ages.

During my visit, I had the privilege of experiencing the special James Cameron exhibit, which was nothing short of remarkable. This showcase offered an in-depth look at the iconic director's groundbreaking work, featuring fascinating artifacts, behind-the-scenes insights, and incredible visuals that highlight his contributions to the film industry. It's a must-see for any film enthusiast!

The museum's architecture further enhances the experience, with its soaring ceilings and captivating design creating an inviting atmosphere. From classic films to modern masterpieces, the curated collections cover the breadth of cinema, making it an enlightening experience.

The Museo Nazionale del Cinema is not just a museum; it's a treasure trove of cinematic wonder that truly inspires and delights. A visit here is an absolute must for anyone visiting Turin!

Amazing and completely worth the price! The lower level of the museum focuses on the history of cinema and how it has become what it is today whilst the upper floors showcase the different genres of movies. Me and my friend spend almost 3 hours in here and definitely could have spent more!!

Absolutely excellent. They had an exhibition on the art of James Cameron on while I visited. Absolutely incredible. They also take right through the history of cinema (with interactive examples in many cases), including the technology that needed to be developed for films to exist. Highly recommend a visit. Make sure you book your time slot. It is very popular. I'd recommend doing the Mole Antonelliana panoramic lift first, and then taking your time in the museum.

places.address: Via Montebello, 20, 10124 Torino TO, Italy

places.generalDescription: Real Chiesa di San Lorenzo is a stunning octagonal Catholic church built in 1687, featuring baroque architecture, frescoes, statues, and a dome. It was originally conceived as a chapel for Palazzo Reale in the central Piazza Castello and designed by Guarini. The church's style reflects the influence of Borromini and showcases Guarini's innovative approach to form.

sources.snippet: Also known as the Royal Church of Saint Lawrence, San Lorenzo is a Baroque-style church adjacent to the Royal Palace of Turin. Known for its breathtakingly adorned cupola, the sanctuary is an architectural gem. Built by architect Guarino Guarini from 1668 to 1687, the plain facade leads to a gorgeous interior.
sources.shortName: 27 Things To Do in Turin, Italy - Travel Tips From a Local

sources.snippet: Next, head to San Lorenzo Church, a baroque masterpiece famous for its unique dome architecture. Although it may be closed in the evening, the exterior is worth admiring under the evening lights, creating a romantic backdrop for an evening stroll.
sources.shortName: Things to do at night in Turin to experience the city like a local

places.name: Real Chiesa di San Lorenzo

reviews.text: It is definitely one of the most beautiful churches that you can visit in Turin
Beautiful Beautiful beautiful church and I love visiting cathedrals  churches as I am pure catholic
From outside is very simple, but inside it is gorgeous and rich in polychrome marble decorations. The ceiling is breathtaking. Paintings are fabulous.

places.address: Via Palazzo di Citt√†, 6, 10122 Torino TO, Italy

places.generalDescription: Caff√© Al Bicerin is a historic coffee bar that has been serving chocolate-based drinks and desserts in a cozy, wood-paneled setting since 1763. The caf√© was redesigned in 1856 by architect Carlo Promis, maintaining its original wooden boiseries and antique silver holders for candles. It is known for serving Turin's famous Bicerin according to the original recipe, a coffee-based drink with chocolate and heavy cream.

sources.snippet: For a chocolate coffee drink, Bicerin is the highlight of Turin. If you‚Äôre a chocolate AND coffee lover, this drink is for you. It mixes espresso, milk and chocolate into one tasty cup.
sources.siteName: Offbeat Escapades | Offbeat Travels & Van Life Blog
sources.shortName: Is Turin Worth Visiting? 7 Reasons Why You Need to Visit Italy's Hidden Gem - Offbeat Escapades
Romantic Torino

places.name: Caff√© Al Bicerin

reviews.text:
The caf√© was founded in 1763 and is famous for its signature drink, the Bicerin-a rich combination of espresso, hot chocolate, and whipped milk, traditionally served in a glass, and should be drank without stirring the mug.

The atmosphere is very cozy, there are plenty place to sit inside or outside.

My second time at the cafe for the Bicerin and nice courtyard feel. The service was friendly and the drink a good balance between chocolate, espresso and cream. Not  sweet nor bitter and they kindly advised you not to stir the drink so that you could taste the different layers.

Caff√® Al Bicerin is a charming slice of Turin's rich coffee heritage. Their signature layered espresso and chocolate drink is delightful, the ambiance cozy and historic, and though it can get busy, the experience-and the taste-is absolutely worth the wait. A must-visit for any coffee lover exploring the city!

places.address: Piazza della Consolata, 5, 10122 Torino TO, Italy

places.generalDescription: Smith's British is a restaurant with a British twist that specializes in savory starters and main courses. The menu has several different options, all of which are well prepared and have unique subtleties. The dessert is especially delicious.

sources.snippet: A British-style dinner not only for the flavors but also for the setting and atmosphere, in a triumph of crystals, silverware, English porcelain, and flowers?. It is possible, just come here, in the Cenisio area, at Smith‚Äôs British, the only British restaurant in Italy. Opened by Adam Smith, it is also the right place for the famous High Tea, the richest version of Afternoon Tea, or for Sunday brunch.
sources.shortName: Where to eat in Turin for Valentine's Day: the 8 restaurants chosen by Gambero Rosso

places.name: Smith's British - Ristorante Inglese

reviews.text: Really nice place for a Sunday brunch!!!! Book the table in advance as it is always very busy!
The duck pat√® is out of this world! The best fish and chips in Turin! Wonderful place to eat,
Im English and it was amazing finding a amazing English restaurant the food was amazing and a good price and great service and very welcoming staff if I could I would give it 10 star's

places.address: Via Virle, 19c, 10138 Torino TO, Italy

places.generalDescription: Eataly Torino Lingotto is a food lover's paradise, offering a wide array of Italian culinary delights. The pizzeria at Eataly takes pride in its light and flavorful pizzas, crafted with a special dough made from carefully selected flours and leavened for over 50 hours.

sources.snippet: The name Eataly has become synonymous around the world with mouthwatering Italian food. With 43 locations across Europe, the Americas, and Asia, Eataly‚Äôs combined food hall and market is impossible to resist. But why visit in Turin when you can go to another location somewhere else?
sources.shortName: 30 Best Things to do in Turin, Italy - Top Tips from a Local

sources.snippet: It‚Äôs time to talk about food, and one of my favorite places to eat in Turin is EATALY. You might have already heard about it, it‚Äôs like a shop/shopping mall selling only Italian products. They have stores worldwide, but you might not know that EATALY is from Turin.
sources.shortName: 27 Things To Do in Turin, Italy - Travel Tips From a Local

places.name: Eataly Torino Lingotto

reviews.text: great place to go shoppring and have a nice dinner. many great food options, to take home. the restaurant was very nice and the service perfect. we git there and where seated directly.

The store has a wide assortment of items.
I  love their pizza with capers and anchovies. Their staff at the dining area were nice and helpful.

I am a great fan of Eataly having been to a number across Europe. The food is always amazing.

This store, next to the original Fiat factory is in a good location. Plenty of seating outside too.

If you arrive when it's busy please expect to wait a while. Locals are used to this but tourists get frustrated üò† just chill!

The staff were very friendly and helpful.

English speaking if required.

places.address: Via Ermanno Fenoglietti, 14, 10126 Torino TO, Italy

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Turin, Blah Blah is a vibrant and eclectic venue that seamlessly blends the charm of a bar, restaurant, concert hall, and even a small cinema. This funky spot offers an impressive array of cocktails and coffee while serving up delicious food options‚Äîdon‚Äôt miss out on their tempting buffet! The atmosphere is electric with live music performances featuring everything from post-punk to experimental sounds.

sources.snippet: Blah Blah in Turin is a vibrant spot known for its lively atmosphere, eclectic decor, and diverse menu. It's a favorite among locals and tourists alike, offering a unique blend of traditional and contemporary dishes, making it a must-visit destination in the heart of Turin.
sources.shortName: Romantic Summer Getaway in Turin for Couples

places.name: Blah Blah

reviews.text:
Great aperitif options meaty and vegetarian options...
Multilingual staff that are friendly and attentive.. relaxed vibe but also consistent with live music midweek and weekends.. definite buzz any night of the week ..

Best place in Turin to see rock and metal bands from all over the world playing live. There's a band playing almost every day! The venue and stage are small and that's what I love the most about Blah Blah because the performances always feel very intimate.

Let me say its not a place for youth . Its an accessible place but what bothers me is that they developed wrong community. When you go there you feel you are in the retirement house dancing with your grandpa. Fully abandoned by young generation. They barely invite alternative artists as other nearby venues do. I do not like it just because of atmosphere and other services are not that exceptional to cover it. I usually go there when there are no any other choices.

places.address: Via Po, 21, 10124 Torino TO, Italy

places.generalDescription: La Limonaia is a beautiful dining establishment located in the Pozzo Strada neighborhood of Turin. As you enter, you will be greeted by an exquisite lemon garden and a charming ambiance. The restaurant's warm lighting, long white tablecloths, and stylish decorations in both Art Deco and Liberty styles create the perfect setting for a romantic dinner. The open kitchen allows guests to witness the skilled chefs combining fragrances, colors, flavors, and fresh high-quality ingredients into delightful dishes.

sources.snippet: An unusual area, among 1970s buildings and a maze of streets with only small doors of private houses facing them. A gate opens onto a courtyard, a small oasis of greenery with some large citrus pots, a lemon house, to be precise. A tastefully furnished greenhouse, a mix of pieces of antiquity and modern art, family memorabilia that make the environment unique and intimate.
sources.shortName: Where to eat in Turin for Valentine's Day: the 8 restaurants chosen by Gambero Rosso

places.name: La Limonaia

reviews.text: Amazing experience. I really enjoyed the mise en bouche, the carpaccio, the gnocchi. Dessert was a whole adventure in itself! Really a must go.
Beautiful location, delicious food, warm and kind service!

A place for connoisseurs. It's a very sophisticated restaurant, built in a former warehouse, on the back of an unsuspecting condominium, but tastefully furnished and effectively transformed into a huge veranda overlooking a courtyard overflowing with plants, both decorative and aromatic. The latter are also used by the kitchen, which also overlooks the courtyard. The menu is simple, but well structured, with starters and appetizers (two distinct sections), first courses, second courses and desserts. In the menu, the dishes are mentioned in a succinct manner, but the waitress will explain them to you in great detail on their articulated and sometimes exotic composition. The wine list is endless, making it almost difficult to decide. Even about drinking, it's pleasant and certainly useful to have a chat and ask the highly trained waitress for a suggestion. The dishes are so composite and original that you will spend some time just having the dishes described and discussing them, almost always also learning about some original and unusual ingredient, on which you may ask any questions, be told and then comment with waitress and between diners. For example, talking about a particular aromatic herb we never heard of before, she went out for a moment in the courtyard to take a sprig, to show it to us, let us touch, smell, taste it and ultimately to allow us to really get to know it!  In short, it is certainly a very "cultural" place, which ranges between world ingredients and gastronomy, but always maintaining firm roots in the Italian and Piedmontese traditions. Never boring, always interesting, a lunch at La Limonaia is like a little journey.  Very friendly service, but also informal and relaxed. Not a cheap place.

places.address: Via Mario Ponzio, 10, 10141 Torino TO, Italy

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the picturesque Piedmont countryside, Vigna Chinet is a delightful venue that exudes romance and intimacy, making it an ideal choice for couples looking to celebrate their love. With space for up to 100 guests, this charming location features a lovely courtyard perfect for outdoor ceremonies and a cozy indoor hall adorned with rustic decor. The expansive vineyards surrounding the property provide stunning backdrops for unforgettable photographs.
places.name: Vigna Chinet

reviews.text:
We chose Vigna Chinet as the venue for our wedding, and it was perfect. The villa and its garden offer the best location in Tustin, combining a warm atmosphere, Piedmontese elegance, tradition, and spectacular views. Lorenzo, the owner and a true gentleman, ensured everything went smoothly. We are extremely satisfied with our choice and highly recommend Vigna Chinet!

Caro Lorenzo, grazie infinite! Anna & Dario
We stayed in this villa for a wedding, fantastic location, beautiful view and we ate very well. all perfect! Great and beautiful place!
Location top

places.address: Via Mirabello, 3/D, 10132 Torino TO, Italy

places.generalDescription: Magazzino 52 is a contemporary enoteca and restaurant that opened recently, offering a diverse selection of traditional and international dishes. The wine list is extensive and impressive, showcasing a deep respect for wine. The food is described as precise, balanced, tasty, and particularly unique. Visitors praise the impeccable service and the restaurant's ability to honor Italian cuisine. Many recommend trying the pasta dishes, even if it's not typically their preferred choice, as they are exceptionally well-prepared.

sources.snippet: Warehouse 52, a stellar local haunt brought to life by friends Diego, Graziano and Dario is all about their united love affair with snacks and booze. The food is Med-inspired at heart, but the boys don‚Äôt forget their roots, with a particular emphasis on Piedmontese traditions. Think tagliolini with rabbit livers and Piedmontese pork bacon with soy sauce.
sources.shortName: The best things to do in Turin: an insider's guide

places.name: Magazzino52

reviews.text: A great Piedmont restaurant with a modern twist , fresh ingredients and well executed. The ambiance is super cozy, highly recommend it
Fantastic curated dishes. Limited menu, but, expertly prepared. Very nice wine selection.
Sensational sensorial experience. The textures tastes and flavours are out of this world. Stunning wine list. Knowledgeable and helpful somms, beautiful atmosphere - just WOw

places.address: Via Giovanni Giolitti, 52/A, 10123 Torino TO, Italy

places.generalDescription: Perched on a lush hilltop, the Basilica di Superga is an impressive 18th-century basilica with an elaborate sanctuary. Offering stunning views of Turin and the surrounding mountains, this beautiful church is a must-visit in the area. Serving as the final resting place of the Savoy family, its grand dome mirrors that of St Peter's Basilica in Rome.

sources.snippet: One of the most spectacular places is the hill of Superga, whose landscape, according to Rousseau, is ‚Äúthe most beautiful spectacle that can strike the human eye‚Äù.
sources.shortName: Valentine‚Äôs day in Turin

places.name: Superga

reviews.text: Awesome view, awesome place  amazing structure. You can see this church from everywhere in Turin

The Church is a must visit place in Turin.Located on hills of turin.It is an amazing structure and a well maintained place.It is a very good place and a Must visit in Turin.Overall it is an amazing piece of architecture.People of all religions can visit this place.
Very special place near turin that you can reach there by car or public bus. You can have great view of city and enjoy the time in the forest.

places.address: 10099 San Mauro Torinese, Metropolitan City of Turin, Italy

places.generalDescription: Antonio Chiodi Latini is a sophisticated dining destination that elevates plant-based cuisine to an art form. This modern restaurant showcases the chef's passion for seasonal ingredients and a deep respect for nature, crafting exquisite homemade pasta dishes alongside indulgent desserts. With a focus on entirely plant-based offerings, Antonio skillfully transforms vegetables into vibrant plates that are both innovative and delicious, steering clear of typical vegan clich√©s.

sources.snippet: Several years have passed since the renowned chef Antonio Chiodi Latini's turn towards integral vegetables. Today, he is a skillful master in treating elements to obtain liquid extracts and solid matter, combining them with leaves, flowers, and essences. His healthy cuisine is absolutely non-trivial, of high quality, and represents an excellent alternative even for the most convinced carnivore.
sources.shortName: Where to eat in Turin for Valentine's Day: the 8 restaurants chosen by Gambero Rosso

places.name: Antonio Chiodi Latini

reviews.text: The perfect vegan fine-dining place in Torino. You can not tell about it, you have to experience this!
Excellent fine-dining experience. Original flavours, each dish was a  little masterpiece and service was impeccable!

This completely vegan no-compromise dinner at Antonio Chiodi Latini was without a doubt the best meal I had on this trip.  I got the 9-experiences with the 4-glasses pairing, and my companion had the 7-experiences with a single glass.  We both were thoroughly impressed with everything.  One of the two extras I got was a nod to molecular gastronomy, with some pods that I think were freeze-dried that you dip in different varieties of olive oil.  Think freeze-dried astronaut ice cream, but with flavors like zucchini, sweet potato, radish, and artichoke.  Interesting, but I'd not get the 9-experiences a second time just for that.  But the other "extra" that I got, and my friend did not, was some little stuffed pasta with this amazing vegetable jus that made me wonder at the chef's ability to get flavor like that out of vegetables. The risotto was perfect, without a drop of cream, the smoked asparagus soup was somehow impossibly just as good as the artichoke soup at a famous place we visited the prior week, and the dessert (main ingredients were strawberries and cucumber cream in a piped almond milk cream cup) and after-dinner drink similar to gin and tonic were sublime.
My dinner companion pointed out that the mung bean pasta at the start, as well as the bamboo dish, had strong Asian fusion influences.  The potato with spice powders and artichoke with mousse dishes were unlike anything I've ever had and seemed completely original.  The one topped with crisp zucchini flowers confused me for a second as it was coming toward the table, because the presentation resembled prawns.
I've yet to find anything close to this at home.  It was a real treat.

places.address: V. Antonio Bertola, 20/B, 10122 Torino TO, Italy
